x ABSTRACT

Sim√µes, Ana Cristina Pantoja. Crescimento de Methylobacterium organophilum em metanol visando √† produ√ß√£o simult√¢nea de prote√≠na de unicelular e metab√≥litos de interesse industrial . Tese de doutorado. Escola de Qu√≠mica, Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro - Brasil, 2022.
Advisor: Nei Pereira Jr, PhD

The objective of the present study was to seek an optimization for the growth of the methylotrophic species Methylobacterium organophilum aiming at the production of microbial biomass, as well as of the substances naturally produced by it associated with its growth. A ssays were carried out in shaken flasks and an instrumented bioreactor using the mineral medium and methanol. Also, the organic nitrogen sources - corn step liquor and yeast extract ‚Äì were evaluated isolatedly and their concentrations optimized. Experimental designs o f the DCCR type (Central Composite Rotational Design) were carried out in shaken flasks, varying the concentration of methanol (4 and 10 g/L) and 1 to 4% corn steep liquor, and 4 g/L of biomass in dry matter weight were produced in 48 h. The data were analyzed in the Statistica progr am and signaled corn steep liquor as an important growth factor. In essay performed in a m echanically stirred bioreactor (STB) using the combination of corn steep liquor and methanol suggest ed in the experimental design, 5 g/L was obtained in 38 h. The substrate- to-cell yield assumed in this assay was 0.8 g.g-1 in fed-batch operation. Another experiment carried out in a S TB, with mineral medium and methanol as substrate resulted in 5 g/L of dry biomass in 40 h, with an associated accumulation of an exopolysaccharide accumulation, which reached a concentration of 8.9 g/L after 36 h. The substrate- to-cell yield achieved in this assay was 0.34 g.g-1 in the initial batch. The polysaccharide produced during the fed batch was characterized as a pseudoplastic. The sugars present in the EPS were hydrolyzed and identified by high- performance chromatography (HPLC), containing glucose, galactose, and maltose, in the proportions of 0,34:1:1, respectively. The accumulation of carotenoids associated with cell growth was also monitored, reaching a maximum concentration of 1.6 mg/L. These pigment s were analyzed by mass spectrometry and characterized as a set of xanthophylls (oxidized carotenoids). In addition, an intracellular granular structure was investigated preliminar ily, detected by transmission electron microscopy (TEM), suggesting the accumulation of polyhydroxyalkanoate (PHA), probably polyhydroxybutyrate. M. organophilum demonstrated a unique ability to produce compounds of commercial interest, leading to a genuine unde rstanding that this species has a distinct metabolism. The use of M. organophilum makes room for platform integration in the context of biorefineries because of its distinct metabolic diversity.
Keywords: bacterial biomass, unicellular protein production, methylotrophs, bioprocess, methanol, carotenoids, exopolysaccharides, PHA.
